review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2021
review.title: Fast But Weird Setup
review.review: I was really wanting this from the time I bought my Xbox Series X and finally got it. 1 terabyte is just not enough storage, and frankly, this additional terabyte hardly slakes my thirst for more storage. Games are getting so big, now, I may still have to add USB storage.This device is fast. Load times are noticeably faster. But the set up is weird. The instructions come in the way of a simple graphical sheet that seems to indicate you just plug it in, so I did what most people would do and powered down my unit and plugged this in. After powering up, I transferred some of my games and apps from the internal drive to this without problem.However, when I went to play a game or start an app that I had transferred to the Seagate, I got an error that it would not run. After some sleuthing online, I found someone in a forum relating that he was told to leave the power on while plugging in the device. So I powered down the Xbox, took the Seagate out, powered up the Xbox, and while powered up, crossed my fingers and plugged in the Seagate.All was right in the world and it's been working fine ever since.
product.title: Seagate Storage Expansion Card for Xbox Series X|S 1TB Solid State Drive - NVMe Expansion SSD for Xbox Series X|S (STJR100...

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2021
review.title: The product is awesome backed by solid Customer Service
review.review: When I first got the batteries and the charger, I plugged them in and charged them till all 4 lights were green. It didn't take long, even with USB charging so I guess they'd been charged before shipping. Always nice!I put one of the batteries in the controller and it wouldn't turn on. I tried another battery and it worked so I put the bad battery in the charger and it showed green as if it was charged.I tried it again... still nothing.I tried the other batteries and found the other 3 batteries worked fine.I was a little miffed and contacted the seller and they responded within the hour. They asked if shipping out another battery would be OK or did I want to replace the item or send it back for a refund. Always nice to have options!I took a chance and asked them to ship another battery to me and surprisingly it was at my door a couple of days later... and it worked! The seller even followed up to make sure everything was OK.For such a cheap item (in the scheme of things) I was very impressed by the Customer Service. They obviously stand behind this product... andfor good reason!I've usually bought chargers that provide a door for the XBox controller to charge through and rest in a cradle but I'd just bought a Series X and couldn't find one where the door fitted on the new controllers. I took a chance on these batteries and I can say for the two or three months I've been using them, they seem pretty solid, especially for the price!I'm not on the Xbox every day but when I use it, I use it for prolonged periods and the batteries just seem to keep running. They've far outlasted any batteries I've bought before.Great product and definitely worth a buy, backed by great Customer Service!
product.title: Rechargeable Battery Packs for Xbox One/Xbox Series X|S, 4 X 1200mAh Xbox One Controller Battery Packs, Rechargeable Batte...

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2021
review.title: Poor battery performance
review.review: Received the product and everything seemed to be exactly as stated in the description. Hooked everything up and let all 4 batteries charge for a full 12 hours before use. Starting from the top I began to rotate them in a clockwise direction to ensure I tested each with a full charge. Two of the batteries averaged an 8 hour play time and the other two averaged a 5 hour play time. None of the four batteries came anywhere near the 15 hours of play time they advertise. Very disappointed. Will be returning soon.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2021
review.title: The console is just OK
review.review: I have had my Series X for a year now and feel I can give a full review finally. The console is just mediocre, the graphics are fine the games are awesome in fact I think Gamepass Ultimate is the best value in gaming right now, I just wish Microsoft had a console that matched it.The audio from the console itself is just silly, unless your TV/Monitor has built in speakers or audio out then you will need to use a HDMI audio extractor, an official wireless headset, or wired headphones connected to the controller, also no bluetooth connections so most modern headsets, and sound systems are useless with this console.The wifi can be very finicky and drops a lot, no other wifi device I have loses connection as much as this console so I have started to use a wired connection.Only 1 USB port in the front is lackluster.This feels like a $300 console not a $500 one.
product.title: Xbox Series X

review.title: Best look elsewhere :(
review.review: There are few things lacking in this product. 1) the power supply kit linking the xbox to the base plate is not sturdy and all. Somewhat flimsy and if not careful, it will easily detach from the base usb port. 2) Battery packs are a headache. I had one of them melt the backside of battery pack, no longer working and could be a hazard. Both of them also lost the charging port inside of the battery pack. I believe these get very hot during charging and therefore, unglue themselves to where the charging port simply disconnect from the hole. I did take these apart and noticed the tiny screws and glue had become detached and no longer charge. This was after about 3 months of use.

review.title: Disappointed, already broken
review.review: I've had then for a over a year at this point. I like them, at first I was just whelmed, not under or over, but this was my first foray into wireless and I don't think I can go back now that I've cut the cord.My problem with then is the joint where the headphones meet the support is made of plastic that is unjustifiably thin. Guess what, they broke there on one side and I just checked the other side and there are cracks as well. I'm going to try to get a replacement under warranty, but I'm just kinda disappointed that a headset that cost me $160 was made so poorly. Thicker plastic, a little metal, either would be fine to make a product that could actually stand up to, idk, putting on and taking off of your head.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 11, 2021
review.title: Great build quality, poor connection quality causes audio issues
review.review: The Headset looks great and sounds great when its not distorted and garbled. It's fine for an hour or so then it will randomly start distorting the audio and will persist till you power the headset off and back on. Razer claims this is a known issue with the new Xbox Series X but it falls short of what MS actually has to say about the issue. The only known issue for the integrated wireless xbox headsets is the audio cut out that requires you to wiggle the thumb sticks. While this headset does not suffer from this issue, I find Razers claims to be FALSE or missleading. I returned the first one and the replacement was even worse with this issue. If you are okay with powering the headset off every couple of hours then this may be the headset for you but I personally would have to recommend to pass on this one till Razer get this issue fixed.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 4, 2021
review.title: Great headset, insane battery life, but there's some hoops to jump through...
review.review: Ok, decided to invest in a legit headset to game on my Xbox Series S with.Ordered a "used" one from a third party seller on Amazon saving myself about $100 by doing so.I get my unit, and despite Amazon saying this was indeed for Series S/X, it did not initially work.I had to hook the base station up to my computer and update the firmware on it first, download a Dolby app on my Series S, and then it would let me set it up as my headset.Quite a bit of steps to jump through, and not a single bit of documentation to walk you through it.So getting set up was a much bigger pain than it should have been.But now that it's set up?It's a beast.The headset sounds amazing.The battery life made it through almost 21 hours of a buddy's 24 hour stream that we were doing.It's very comfortable also.If you are buying this for your Series S/X, and don't mind doing some google searching to get set up, it's an amazing headset.If you are not inclined or do not have a home computer, you might want to give this a pass.
product.title: ASTRO Gaming A50 Wireless Headset + Base Station Gen 4 - Compatible with Xbox Series X|S, Xbox One, PC, Mac - Black/Gold

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 3, 2021
review.title: Died after 5 months of average to low use
review.review: This headset died after 5 months of use.Prior to completely dying, it was fairly consistently having issues the whole time.More often then not the Xbox wasn't seeing the microphone.After unplugging and plugging back in the charging base the Xbox would then recognize the microphone.The current problem is related to charging, and holding a charge.The headset will no longer charge on the base.Not sure if it is the headset or the base that is the issue.I have been fighting the charging issue as well periodically during the 5 months of use.Either way this is a very expensive headset and hasn't lived up to the price tag. When it did work it sounded good, but I don't believe it sounded any better then the Turtle Beach headset that I had prior to this.I would recommend you purchase a different product.
product.title: ASTRO Gaming A50 Wireless Headset + Base Station Gen 4 - Compatible with Xbox Series X|S, Xbox One, PC, Mac - Black/Gold

review.title: Very poor connectivity with PC (HP Omen)
review.review: I was very excited for these after reading the reviews, but they struggled to connect with my PC (HP Omen). Even fully charged, manually syncing and turning off and on again, they would refuse to connect with my PCand my USBs work just fine. This was proved with a nice pair (cheaper) of Nubwo headphones that connected perfectly on try number one. I tried with these headphones for nearly two weeks and gave up, return was easy through amazon at a local Kohls. Very disappointed, when it was able to connect and stay connected the audio quality was good and the microphone worked great for calls. Super inconsistent connectivity that I (an engineer) wasn't able to derive any patterns of. Big sad.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2021
review.title: Left analog stick drifts
review.review: After using it extremely sparingly for a little over 2 months (maybe only actually used it for a total of <10 hours), I noticed the left analog stick drifting up after almost every movement. This effectively renders the controller useless as I cannot trust the controller while playing game.For this price, I‚Äôd recommend getting a regular Xbox controller and a new game rather than this malfunction prone controller
product.title: Elite Series 2 Controller - Black

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2021
review.title: Stick Drift caused by adjusting the tension
review.review: This controller was absolutely amazing at first. The batteries last forever compared to AAs or a rechargeable pack. The extra buttons can be mapped so you don't have to take your fingers off the sticks giving you a great advantage in FPS games.However after less than 4 months the left stick is starting to drift making it a liability online. Microsoft support wants me to mail it in and it will either be repaired or replaced after 2 weeks.As nice as it is I would rather have kept the controller that came with the console now. This controller is too pricey to not be able play for that long. I gave my other controller to a friend after theirs was damaged so it's the only one I have.Update: I chatted with MS rep and they pretty much confirmed that the stick drift is caused by adjusting the tension on the sticks. So even though it's a feature you should never adjust it lol.
product.title: Elite Series 2 Controller - Black

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2021
review.title: IF YOU ARE GETTING 600 MB/S WRITE SPEEDS READ THIS!!
review.review: I see some questions and reviews about getting 600Mb/s in tests on windows. This happened to me too. I did some digging and found out that you can change a setting to increase it to around 1900 Mb/s (likely the real world max). My first test transferred files at 350 Mb/s from my internal 970 evo to the X5 (the speed test was 600, real world was 350) and now it's transferring at 1.4 Gb/sWARNING!!!!! IF YOU DO THIS YOU MUST MANUALLY EJECT YOUR DRIVE EVERY TIME OR RISK DATA LOSS!!!WARNING!!!!! IF YOU DO THIS YOU MUST MANUALLY EJECT YOUR DRIVE EVERY TIME OR RISK DATA LOSS!!!To eject a drive on windows, look in the system tray on the bottom right hand corner of the screen and find the "safely remove hardware" icon. Click it and select the X5HOW TO INCREASE WRITE SPEED:Go to device managerexpand "disk drives" menuright click the X5go to policies tabcheck "better performance"check "enable write caching on the device"do NOT check "turn off write cache buffer"click okay and the device will reconnect.Enjoy 1900 Mb/sREMEMBER THAT YOU MUST EJECT THE DRIVE MANUALLY IF YOU SELECT THIS OPTION!!!!REMEMBER THAT YOU MUST EJECT THE DRIVE MANUALLY IF YOU SELECT THIS OPTION!!!!

review.title: Does not work on 3 different Macs
review.review: Could not get this to mount on 3 different Macs, running Catalina and Big Sur and High Sierra. On the other hand the G-Drive 2 TB mount just fine on all three, plays well with others. Fortunately I was able to return it in time, thanks Amazon.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on September 28, 2021
review.title: 2-3x as fast as Samsung T5
review.review: When transferring large (ie. 50GB) files containing photos and videos, the Samsung X5 was 2x as fast as the T5 at reading and 3x as fast at writing. Aside from the high cost, I highly recommend this drive.
product.title: Sponsored Ad - Samsung X5 Portable SSD - 1TB - Thunderbolt 3 External SSD (MU-PB1T0B/AM) Gray/Red

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on September 17, 2021
review.title: Advertised speeds with TB3/TB4
review.review: Your browser does not support HTML5 video.¬†Strangely, this thing gets better write speeds then my internal Sabrent Rocker Q4 Gene nvme drive. The Sabrent wins in reads bit even when plugged into a TB4 elements hub, I get full speeds as my ASRock Nuc only has 1 TB4 port.I'm currently us√≠ng this as my performance tier drive for windows storage spaces with 2 14TB WD 7200RPM in a simple virtual disk (software RAID0). This has to be configured via PowerShell and is not supported by Microsoft. Essentially anything written to the 25.7TB drive is written to the X5, then the X5 writes the data to the spinning drives in the background. This gets me 1.6GB/s write speeds in bursts, then drop down to 600/500MB/s. It will get a bit slower if you fare copying enough data to fill the X5. Meaning that since I got the 500GB model, speed will start to slow down when transferring over 500GB of data which is rare. You can do this by creating different tiers. Google "Storage spaces ssd cached drive" to learn how to set it up this way. If you attempt to do this via the GUI you will just blindly be throwing this in and would be a complete waste.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on September 15, 2021
review.title: Just as fast or faster than the built-in drive!
review.review: I absolutely LOVE this drive. For not a whole lot of money, its Thunderbolt connection gives me speeds just as fast as the built-in SSD on my mid-2020 iMac. It's perfect for holding my Steam library, collection of virtual machines, emulator ROMs, and other things that I don't want NAS latency for.
product.title: Sponsored Ad - Samsung X5 Portable SSD - 1TB - Thunderbolt 3 External SSD (MU-PB1T0B/AM) Gray/Red

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on September 12, 2021
review.title: Very fast
review.review: I needed to buy this to replace my iMac's failed Fusion drive. It performs BETTER than using the internal Fusion drive did. I only wish it had been more clear about already coming with a Thunderbolt cable. I bought one thinking that it didn't, but could have saved the expense since this came with one. Speaking of expense, this is definitely a pricey item. But the performance is exceptional! It can run hot, however, depending on use.
product.title: Sponsored Ad - Samsung X5 Portable SSD - 1TB - Thunderbolt 3 External SSD (MU-PB1T0B/AM) Gray/Red

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on September 8, 2021
review.title: Fast, Nice Design and Construction But Prone to Thermal Throttling
review.review: This is a very well made external SSD and for many tasks will perform flawlessly, resulting in fast transfers or 2K video editing, etc. The main problem with this device (and it's common / not specific to Samsung) is that after a few mintues of continuous data transfer or other demanding task, the NVMe drive inside will start to rapidly heat up. When it gets to a certain temperature, the device automatically throttles down to prevent damage to the drive or internal components, then after a few minutes of low use or idle time, it will return to a state where it can deliver top speeds. The best I've seen were over 2200 MB/s write and 2500 MB/s read, but more typically you'll see something like 1200 MB/s write, because of the problem described above. Still faster than a Gen 2 USB drive but a pretty big drop regardless.So if you're looking to use this for highend video editing (feeding raw footage off the drive), you probably will want to look elsewhere. If you just want a really fast backup drive or a working drive for your Photoshop projects or the like, it's great. The main limits will be encountered by video profressionals and scientific computing professionals.
